page.title: 15News from Creeting School
page.content: The school has had a busy year with many activities and outings. The 7-9 year olds visited the London Planetarium and Madame Tussauds by train in May and the 5-7 year olds, Norton Bird Gardens and Chadacre Agricultural Institute by bus in July. Other visits have been made to see houses old and new, a farm, pets, lambs and nature trails. People visiting the school included children from Ringshall school and a policeman, postman and parent who all came to give a talk. The Sports were held on July 17th, postponed by rain from the day before. A school leavers' service was held in church on July 19th. The children read the lesson, chose the hymns and took the collection. They decided to give this to a school for disabled children and they took it there the next day.
